com.yantra.api.wms.task

Interface getNextDepositLocation

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface getNextDepositLocation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getNextDepositLocation(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      getNextDepositLocation determines all the dropoff/target locations for the tasks picked by a user.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextDepositLocation

        org.w3c.dom.Document getNextDepositLocation(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException
        getNextDepositLocation determines all the dropoff/target locations for the tasks picked by a user. Tasks can be either regular (individual) task or consolidation tasks (tasks having successor tasks). Dropoff locations will consist of a list of locations that will be outstaging location (and its outstaging location) of source location and common instaging locations of the target locations. The suggestion of tasks and locations will be as follows:
        1. Execution through Dropoff is 'Y' and dropoff locations using above algorithm could be found: In this case, a list of all the tasks and a list of all the dropoff locations is given. If all the tasks have a common target location, the target location is also suggested as a dropoff. The DepositAll flag is set to 'Y'. The locations are ordered in putaway sequence. The first location according to putaway sequence is also defaulted in the locationId field in DepositLocation element.
        2. Execution through Dropoff is 'Y' and no dropoff could be found: In this case, the DepositAll flag is set to 'N'. The first location according to putaway sequence is defaulted in the DepositLocation element and a list of all the tasks to be deposited to that location are shown in the TaskList.
        3. Execution through Dropoff is 'N': List of all dropoff locations are shown and depositing at either drop off location or target location is allowed.
        4. After Partial Deposit: Once all the InProgress tasks are completed, tasks which are in held status because of partial deposit are looked for and suggested. In this case dropoff locations are also suggested even though the task does not say 'Execute Through Dropoff'.

        While suggesting tasks getNextDepositLocation API considers the Aisle User Constraints and Zone User Constraints and tries to mitigate the congestion at the target location. It prefers tasks targeted to another location/aisle over a task if the number of users currently working in the target aisle of the task violates the maximum number of users allowed. Behaviour is the same if another user is currently working at the target location of the task and the target zone of the task is configured to disallow multiple users simultaneously in a location.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: None

        Database Extensibility Support: None

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the details of the count result. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
